metadata.title: Modeling Walleye Pollock Recruitment in the Eastern Bering Sea: Use of Physical Data Integrated with Stock Assessment Information

creators.name: Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), National Marine Fisheries Service (NMFS), Alaska Fisheries Science Center (AFSC)

metadata.description: The assessment of Eastern Bering Sea (EBS)  Walleye Pollock presented to managers has increasingly been sensitive to year-class abundance estimates prior to their availability to the fishery.  The fishery from this region has annually produced an excess of 1 million tons of Pollock for the past two decades.  Data from two surveys proved to be crucial in developing a harvest strategy for 1997 and for projecting the expected fishery impacts in the short term (for 1998 - 2000).
metadata.notes:
Purpose: To show a model of the Walleye Pollock recruitment in the eastern Bering Sea: use of physical data integrated with stock assessment information
